case_title: Syed MUHAMMAD AMIN SHAH vs AZAD GOVERNMENT OF THE STATE OF JAMMU & KASHMIR And Another
court: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunal
respondant: Azad Government of the State of Jammu & Kashmir

accussed_details.name: Syed Muhammad Amin Shah
allegation: Challenged retirement order under Section 12 of Azad Jammu and Kashmir Civil Servant Act, 1976

complaint_summary: The appellant challenged his retirement order issued by the respondent under Section 12 of the Azad Jammu and Kashmir Civil Servant Act, 1976, claiming it violated his service terms and conditions and that he was entitled to remain in service until the age of 60.
investigation_summary: The respondent argued that the appellant's retirement was lawful and in accordance with Section 12 of the Civil Servant Act, 1976, which allows retirement after 25 years of service in the public interest.
judgment_summary: The Tribunal upheld the respondent's retirement order, stating it was lawful and aligned with the terms and conditions of service under Section 12 of the Civil Servant Act, 1976. The Tribunal emphasized that the discretion to retire a civil servant lies with the competent authority and cannot be interfered with. The Tribunal also clarified that civil servants cannot claim retention in service as a right after completing 25 years of service.
legal_arguments: Appellant argued the retirement order violated Section 12 of the Civil Servant Act, 1976 and his service terms.
Respondent contended the retirement was lawful and in the public interest under Section 12(ii) of the Act.
statutes: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Civil Servant Act, 1976
Azad Jammu and Kashmir Constitution Act, 1974
sections: Section 12 of Azad Jammu and Kashmir Civil Servant Act, 1976
Section 49 of Azad Jammu and Kashmir Constitution Act, 1974
key_issues: Validity of retirement order under Section 12 of Civil Servant Act, 1976
Discretion of competent authority in retiring civil servants

legal_terms.Retirement: The act of ending employment, often with pension benefits.
legal_terms.Public Interest: Actions or decisions made for the welfare of the general public.

words_and_phrases.Competent Authority: The official body or person authorized to make decisions regarding civil servants.
words_and_phrases.Pensionary Benefits: Financial benefits provided to retired employees.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves a service appeal filed by Syed Muhammad Amin Shah challenging his retirement order issued under Section 12 of the Azad Jammu and Kashmir Civil Servant Act, 1976. The Tribunal upheld the retirement order, emphasizing the competent authority's discretion in retiring civil servants after 25 years of service in the public interest. The Tribunal also noted that it cannot question the propriety or public interest determination made by the competent authority.
